posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
I know this topic has been posted in CD for more than couple time but here again.

I am trying to get keyboard and mouse control for robot working, so after some ChatGPT and googling, I made a python script based on pygame which would capture keyboard and mouse action and send it to networktables.

35891722108849_.pic 1332√ó1076 110 KB

35891722108849_.pic 1332√ó1076 110 KB

35891722108849_.pic 1332√ó1076 110 KB

This would send qwertasdfghzxcv12345 keys and mouse speed to networktable for use. Of couse a lot of modification would be needed on the robot side to handle this control so this is still a work in progress.

image 1608√ó1354 348 KB

image 1608√ó1354 348 KB

image 1608√ó1354 348 KB

Also robot needs to be enabled by DS . If running DS and this on the same computer, Space Bar will e-stop the robot.

Any suggestion is appreciated.

link_counts.title: GitHub - sikaxn/frc-nt-fps: Keyboard and mouse control for FRC robot

posts.name: Tauseef Afraz
posts.cooked: Driving swerve with WASD and rotating with mouse lol

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
NathanZhou:

Of couse a lot of modification would be needed on the robot side to handle this control so this is still a work in progress.

Not all that much if you‚Äôre using the commands library:

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button, class: NetworkButton

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: and L-Shift as a ‚Äúgear shift‚Äù to cycle acceleration rates/characterists.

posts.name: Mykah
posts.cooked: Oh and something else to add: A very different approach, but also the easiest I can think of personally (based on my own skills so YMMV) would be to use a PS/2 backwards compatible keyboard and mouse and use that interface to connect them up to a micro-controller capable of emulating a Joystick like an Arduino Leonardo/ATMega32u4 equivalent and mapping to buttons, throttles/axis, etc. in in the micro-controller code leaving your robot code more stock standard.

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked:
i made a tool for replicating an xbox controller with keyboard in python - GitHub - vikings204/vCon: keyboard xbox 360 controller, designed for RDP use

it has an expanded symmetrical WASD-esque layout, with config on LSHIFT that allows you to change the value of a pressed axis (ex. W = 100% LX)
